Sentence.sentence: The House bill would authorize the secretary of health and human services to negotiate drug prices in Medicare and Medicaid.
Perhaps there is less to fight about, with the country in a period of tranquility and the dangers of drug abuse and other unwholesome behavior well known.

Is surgery, radiation or careful monitoring best for prostate ( ' ,  前列腺) cancer? Is the latest and most expensive cholesterol-lowering drug any better than its common competitors? The pending bills would spend additional money to accelerate this effort.
In time it should help restrain costs by eliminating redundant tests, preventing drug interactions, and helping doctors find the best treatments.
From other sources, we also know teenage crime, drug abuse and premarital sex are in general decline.
Conversion of paper to electronic medical records will help eliminate redundant tests and prevent drug interactions.
Contrary to analysts' doubts, the author believes drug prices may be lowered through negotiation.
While  most parents, teachers and clinicians would react to an adolescent using drugs or getting drunk, they may easily  overlook teenagers who are engaging in inconspicuous behaviors.
Their  risky behaviors—drinking too much alcohol, using illegal drugs, smoking cigarettes and skipping school—can  alert parents and teachers that serious problems are brewing.
The  study's  authors  surveyed  12,395  students  and  analyzed  nine  risk  behaviors,  including  excessive  alcohol use, illegal drug use, heavy smoking, high media use and truancy ( ' ,  逃学 ).
Many teenagers resort to drugs or alcohol for mental relief.
They may have to use less effective drugs.
Studies have shown, for example, that two drugs are about equally effective in treating macular degeneration, an eye disease.
Medicare could save hundreds of millions of dollars a year if everyone used the cheaper drug, Avastin, instead of the costlier one, Lucentis.

In practical terms, the new guidelines being develop could result in doctors choosing one drug over another for cost reasons or even deciding that a particular treatment — at the end of life, for example — is too expensive.
But the Food and Drug Administration has not approved Avastin for use in the eye, and using it rather than the alternative, Lucentis, might carry an additional, although slight, safety risk.
They can be treated with the same drug.
And is it true that some singers use drugs before concerts to boost their voices when they have voice problems?
Side effects of some common drugs
Smuggling drugs into Hong Kong.
Alcohol may increase the effect of a drug.

sameAnalysis.word_list: drug, medicine, medication, remedy, cure, chemical
means: drug ： 普通用词，含义广泛，可指任何用于预防或治疗肉体上或精神上疾病的药品。用复数形式，多指毒品。
medicine ： 普通用词，可指药物的总称，也指一切有利于健康的东西。
medication ： 指医生开给病人用的一切药物，从最简单的阿斯匹林到最复杂的药物。
remedy ： 普通用词，侧重指对恢复健康有效的药品或治疗方法。
cure比remedy更强调使身体恢复健康的疗法或良药。
chemical ： 多指工业或化学中的药品，有时也指医药中的药品。

example.en: The drug lords like Mr Tom seem never to get arrested.
example.zh: 像汤姆先生那样的毒品贩子好像永远都不会被逮捕。

word_mean: 药，药物：用于诊断、治疗及预防人和动物疾病或其他病理情况以解除疼痛或病损，控制及改善生理和病理状态的化合物

lj.lj_ly: on drugs for high blood pressure.

entry.def: A drug is a chemical which is given to people in order to treat or prevent an illness or disease.

example.ex: The drug will be useful to hundreds of thousands of infected people.
example.tran: 这种药将惠及成千上万的感染者。

entry.def: Drugs are substances that some people take because of their pleasant effects, but which are usually illegal.

example.ex: His mother was on drugs, on cocaine...
She was sure Leo was taking drugs...

entry.def: If you drug a person or animal, you give them a chemical substance in order to make them sleepy or unconscious.

example.ex: They drugged the guard dog with doped meatballs...
example.tran: 他们用掺了麻醉药的肉丸子麻醉了看门狗。
她被人下了药，然后遭到抢劫。

entry.def: If food or drink is drugged, a chemical substance is added to it in order to make someone sleepy or unconscious when they eat or drink it.
entry.tran: 往（食物或饮料中）投放麻醉药

example.ex: I wonder now if that drink had been drugged...
example.tran: 我现在想那饮料是否被人动过手脚。

example.ex: Anyone could have drugged that wine.
example.tran: 指不定谁在那酒里下了药。

means.word_mean: 1. a substance that is used as a medicine or narcotic

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French drogue, possibly from Middle Dutch droge vate, literally 'dry vat's', referring to the contents (i.e. dry goods)

sentences.cn: 为了帮助我们自己和他人，了解一些关于毒品的知识是很重要的。

sentences.cn: 毒品是一种化学物质。
sentences.en: A drug is a chemical substance.

sentences.cn: 酒和烟草是毒品。
sentences.en: Alcohol and tobacco are drugs.

sentences.cn: 咖啡因——咖啡和一些软饮料中存在的一种物质——也是一种毒品。
sentences.en: Caffeine, a substance found in coffee and some soft drinks, is also a drug.

sentences.cn: 吸毒指的是合法或非法的毒品服用行为，且这种行为会伤害此人或与他关系亲密的人。
sentences.en: Drug abuse is the use of a drug, legal or illegal, that hurts a person or someone close to him.
sentences.from: 15年12月四级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 吸毒者即服用毒品的人。
sentences.en: A drug user is the person who takes the drug.
sentences.from: 15年12月四级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 试探性的吸毒者可能会尝试一次或两次毒品。
sentences.en: Experimental users may try drugs once or twice.
sentences.from: 15年12月四级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 消遣性的吸毒者通过吸食毒品来获得兴奋感。
sentences.en: Recreational users take drugs to get high.
sentences.from: 15年12月四级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 依赖性的吸毒者对毒品之外的任何事物都不感兴趣。
sentences.en: Dependent users can’t relate to anything but drugs.
sentences.from: 15年12月四级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 他们的全部生活都以毒品为中心。
sentences.en: Their whole life centers around drugs.
sentences.from: 15年12月四级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 没有毒品，他们在精神或生理上就会感到极度痛苦。
sentences.en: They feel extreme mental or physical pain without drugs.
sentences.from: 15年12月四级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 有时候，人们太喜欢或需要毒品了，没有毒品就不行。
sentences.en: Sometimes people like drugs or need drugs so much, they can’t do without them.
sentences.from: 15年12月四级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 他们对毒品有了依赖性。
sentences.en: They are dependent upon drugs.
sentences.from: 15年12月四级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 只有少数种类的毒品会导致生理依赖。
sentences.en: Only a few kinds of drugs can cause physical dependence.
sentences.from: 15年12月四级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 但是在被滥用的情况下，几乎所有毒品都会使人认为自己离不开它了。
sentences.en: But almost any drug, when it’s misused, can make a person think he needs it all the time.

sentences.en: MPs called for tougher enforcement of the existing laws on drugs.

sentences.cn: 另一方面,合法地 ( 即按处方 ) 服用毒品, 则是普遍而且完全可以接受的.
sentences.en: Legal ( i . e. prescription ) drug use , on the other hand, is widespread and perfectly acceptable.

sentences.cn: 最为激进的是, 有些州正在考虑将毒品完全法律化.
sentences.en: Most radically, some states are considering legalising the drug completely.

sentences.en: The doctor drugged his patient quickly.
